greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of 8th powers in the multiplicative group modulo n.
comment: The size of the set of numbers j^8 mod n, gcd(j,n)=1, 1<=j<=n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Richard J. Mathar, Size of the Set of Residues of Integer Powers of Fixed Exponent, research paper, 2017.
formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1 for e<=5, a(2^e) = 2^(e-5) for e>=5; a(p^e) = (p-1)*p^(e-1)/8 for p == 1 (mod 8); a(p^e) = (p-1)*p^(e-1)/4 for p == 5 (mod 8); a(p^e) = (p-1)*p^(e-1)/2 for p == {3,5} (mod 8). - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 15 2017
maple: for j from 1 to n do
program: \\ The following two functions by _Charles R Greathouse IV_, from A247257:
xref: The number of k-th powers in the multiplicative group modulo n: A046073 (k=2), A087692 (k=3), A250207 (k=4), A293482 (k=5), A293483 (k=6), A293484 (k=7), this sequence (k=8).
Cf. A085311, A247257 (order of the kernel isomorphism of Z/nZ to this group), A000010.
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 10 2017
